    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(int x,
    int y)
        Creates a new tile with the specified rel_x and rel_y coordinates in a standard Cartesian plane coordinate system
        Parameters:
        x - the rel_x coordinate
        y - the rel_y coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • pickupLoot

        public Loot pickupLoot()
        Returns a loot object that was on the cell currently or null if there was no loot on the cell
        Returns:
        Loot object that was on the cell or null if there was nothing

      • hasLoot

        public final boolean hasLoot()
        Returns whether the tile has a loot object on it.

      • putLoot

        public void putLoot(Loot l)
             throws IllegalInventoryException
        Puts the specified Loot on the cell. If there was loot there already, it merges the two Loot object together
        Parameters:
        l - the Loot that will be put on the cell
        Throws:
        IllegalInventoryException - if the merging of inventories failed

      • getOccupant

        public GameCharacter getOccupant()
        Returns a reference to the current occupant of the cell. Will return null if there is no occupant occupying the cell.
        Returns:
        Creature reference that currently on the cell. Will return null if no creature is occupying the cell

      • setOccupant

        public void setOccupant(GameCharacter c)
                 throws TileException
        Sets the occupant of the cell. If a creature is already there this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException as this method should not be called if there is an occupant already on the cell.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature that will be put on the cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is an occupant on the cell already
        TileException

      • removeOccupant

        public GameCharacter removeOccupant()
        Polls the Creature occupant on the cell. Then sets the occupant to null indicating there is no occupant on the cell
        Returns:
        Creature that occupied the cell up until this method was called

      • getResource

        public DrawableResource getResource()
        Returns a DrawableResource used to draw the tile on the screen
        Returns:
        a DrawableResource that represents the tile

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Returns the position of tile in its relative x, y coordinate
        Returns:
        a point position encapsulating the x, y coordinate of the tile in the standard Cartesian plane

      • getDirection

        public static Directions getDirection(java.awt.Point delta)
        Returns the Directions of an adjacent tile as the enum itself
        Parameters:
        delta - the relative location of the adjacent target tile in respect to the source tile
        Returns:
        a Directions that represents in what direction the destination target tile is

      • getDelta

        public static java.awt.Point getDelta(Tile t1,
                      Tile t2)
        Returns the Manhattan Distance between two tiles
        Parameters:
        t1 - the source tile
        t2 - the destination tile
        Returns:
        an Point with the differences between the x coordinates and the differences between the y coordinates

      • getCost

        public static double getCost(Tile t1,
             Tile t2)
        Returns the average cost to move from one tile to the other
        Parameters:
        t1 - the source tile
        t2 - the destination tile
        Returns:
        a double value representing the average between the two tile connections

      • linkTiles

        public static void linkTiles(Tile t1,
             Tile t2)
        Creates a TileRecord between the two tiles, effectively 'linking' them together for traversal through Dijkstra's algorithm
        Parameters:
        t1 - the source tile
        t2 - the target tile

      • getMovementCost

        public abstract int getMovementCost()
        Returns the integer movement cost for the specific cell type
        Returns:
        integer movement cost for the cell type

      • getImageOffset

        public int[] getImageOffset()
        Returns an integer array image offset, with two values {x, y} offset values
        Returns:
        an integer array consisting of the x, y values of the image offsets
